articles.title: "Rhythmic surges" detected in Africa where a new ocean is forming - Earth.com
articles.description: Scientists found a rhythmic mantle plume beneath Ethiopia is slowly tearing Africa apart - hinting at the birth of a new ocean.
articles.content: Deep beneath the Earth’s surface, in a layer called the mantle, heat builds up and pulses, causing rock to slowly rise toward the crust. This movement is known as a mantle upwelling, and it plays a m… [+5281 chars]
